reviewText: This film a lot more racist than I remembered. Like, A LOT. But it's from the 60s and they weren't exactly sensitive to that sort of thing back then.  It's still a fun action-packed 007 adventure.
To see one of the earlier James Bond Connery movies in HD is such a treat.

The cover of this product is a beautifully designed steelbook, based on the credits sequence imagery, for this, the fifth Bond film starring Sean Connery. James Bond travels to Japan to investigate the disappearance of a US rocket. This is a fantastic adventure story, still massively enjoyable after all these years.

Very cool case ART ! It's the same transfer as earlier Blu's but you get a new Ultraviolet DL too. I usually don't double dip in that I already had the same blu ray disc from an earlier release but I thought the steelbook art was very cool ! I didn't buy from Amazon though in this case. Of course The movie is great too !
